lore: Yseros knew that the size and shape of Watchers, as well as their ability to fly, made them especially lethal as spellcasters. The first human biologists who studied Ophans discovered that, despite their intelligence, they do not have the biological support to move or to think. It was three centuries later, when magic became part of the scientific method, that another biologist found that the ring around their body has a magical circuit that emulates the usual structures of other living beings.
menagerieDialog: (It appears to be deep in its own thoughts.)
(You're amazed at how much aggressive emotion a single eye can convey. It's time to take this creature out for a few battles.)
(It's staring directly at you. You can't but feel judged.)
(You can't help but find this creature's tiny little mouth endearing, even if it's mostly hidden by an enormous, bloodshot eyeball.)
(It closes its eye in an obvious attempt to make you think it's sleeping. You decide to leave it alone for now.)
name: Enim Ophan
